definition: Master Zhu, another name for Zhu Xi 朱熹
surname Zhu
vermilion
cinnabar/see 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Secondly, we study specifically the auxiliary verbs in Zhu Zi Yu Nei.
sentences.chinese: 其次，具体分析了《朱子语类》中的单音节助动词。

sentences.english: Zhuzi Doctrine produced profound influences on modern society of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 朱子学对近世日本社会产生了深远影响。

sentences.english: Lee Toegye is a great classical master of Korea.
sentences.chinese: 李退溪是韩国儒学中继承朱子学传统的大师。

sentences.english: Zhu's NeoConfucianism was an enormous theoretical system, the kernel of which was Zhu's view of heavenly principles.
sentences.chinese: 朱子的理学体系是个庞大的系统，其核心则是天理观。

sentences.english: In chapter six, Zhu Xi's school has conquered Wen Zhou finally.
sentences.chinese: 在第六章，朱熹的朱子学派最终征服了温州。

sentences.english: Mou' article and develops the second introduction, with main concern on whether the division of Li Chi binary of Chu His theory is inaccurate.
sentences.chinese: 其中主要涉及到朱子学理气二元之区分是否有问题？

definition: Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
Cheng Yi (1033-1107), Song neo-Confucian scholar
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucius and Mencius
Confucianism
scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
philosophical book by Song dynasty scholar Zhou Dunyi 周敦頤|周敦颐[Zhou1 Dun1 yi2], starting from an interpretation of the Book of Changes
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
Cheng Hao (1032-1085), Song neo-Confucian scholar
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
Li Zhi (1527-1602), late Ming philosopher, historian and writer
Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073), Song dynasty neo-Confucian scholar
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
